definition: variant of 搭檔|搭档[da1 dang4]
to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)

sentences.english: He and I had teamed together a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他和我已经搭挡了很长时间。

sentences.english: She cast a sly glance at her bridge partner.
sentences.chinese: 她向桥牌搭挡使了个会意的眼色。

definition: to act together/to put on a joint performance
to appear in sb's show/to give one's support
special guest performer (in a show)/special guest appearance (in film credits)
variant of 保鏢|保镖[bao3 biao1]
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple
(Tw) to take over sb's job/to substitute for
